poem:
"Under the Shadows of an Ornamental Cuckoo"

The songbird sings on silent tracks,
Each note a penny, a yawn of brass unfurling.
A hurtling engine teeters, fate hung in the balance.
Frost clings to steel where footprints etch no more,
Haunted echoes of jingling bells bedeck the empty hallways.
Tonight, the market sleeps, a child cocooned in gaudy wrap,
In dreams of gold, we find ourselves made poorer.
